A New Era in Women's History With the Center for Women’s History, the San Diego History Center amplifies the stories, achievements and experience of women throughout the San Diego region.  LEARN MORE Explore how the San Diego History Center is impacting our San Diego community. VIEW OUR NEW IMPACT REPORT Discover the rich history and story of San Diego We invite you to explore our many
exhibitions on display here at the
San Diego History Center. ALL EXHIBITIONS Collections online initiative Support for the San Diego History Center’s Digital Collections Initiative is made possible by a generous grant from Karen and Bob Bowden and the Bowden Family Foundation JOIN US Upcoming events, films, tours and more Join us for a wide range
of programs – there’s something
for visitors of all ages. ALL EVENTS Your Support Ignites Curiosity, Builds Pride, and Empowers
Young Minds Support our mission, expand our
reach and impact even more young lives. DONATE NOW

A New Era in Women's History  With the Center for Women’s History, the San Diego History Center amplifies the stories, achievements and experience of women throughout the San Diego region.  LEARN MORE Explore how the San Diego History Center is impacting our San Diego community. the rich history
and story
of San Diego We invite you to explore
our many exhibitions

San Diego History Center in Balboa Park

Wednesday through Sunday, 10am – 5pm

Check this page for changes to operating days and hours

Junipero Serra Museum in Presidio Park

Check this page for updated operating days/hours.

Upcoming Events

History Explorers: Julian Gold Rush

January 17, 11:00 am – 2:00 pm

Join us for a golden adventure! This month’s History Explorers invites kids to dive into the Julian Gold Rush, examine real artifacts, and try their hand at hands-on “gold panning” fun.

 

San Diego Paint & Sip

January 22, 6:00 pm – 9:00 pm

Join the San Diego History Center for another fun Paint & Sip evening at Gossip Grill in Hillcrest! This month, we’re kicking off the new year with a painting inspired by San Diego’s iconic downtown waterfront

View All Upcoming Museum Events

Please check these online resources to keep in touch and engaged with us:

  • Online Research Archives resources
  • Learn At Home virtual learning support resources
  • History Happening Now: Share Your Story SDHC’s COVID 19 reflection collection initiative
  • Virtual Discussions on the SDHC YouTube Channel
  • Join us on social media (Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, or YouTube ) for updates, photos, videos, and more!

The San Diego History Center a Smithsonian Affiliate and member to the San Diego Museum Council and Balboa Park Cultural Partnership.

The San Diego History Center is funded in part by the City of San Diego Commission for Arts and Culture and by the County of San Diego.
